conversation.message: That is an excellent and crucial question, Student_A. We view college counseling as a highly personalized journey, not a standardized process. conversation.message: That is an insightful final question, Student_A, and it touches on the heart of our community culture. We believe true leadership is developed through active participation and responsibility. For collaboration, our curriculum mandates collaborative project work across all subjects, ensuring students learn to negotiate and contribute within diverse teams. For leadership development, we offer a tiered system: starting with informal roles in class projects, moving to formal positions within our 40+ diverse extracurricular clubs (ranging from competitive robotics to community service), and culminating in significant roles within the Student Council and various school governance committees. Students in governance are not just figureheads; they hold real responsibilities in shaping policy regarding student life, academic integrity, and campus events. This structure ensures every student has multiple avenues to practice influence, decision-making, and accountability, preparing them fully for civic life and leadership roles beyond high school. We are deeply committed to fostering these skills. What type of extracurricular involvement are you most interested in pursuing?
